isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Vibration Damper, Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel, and Crankcase - Install - Fit Bearings

step1.para: Install new bearing(s) in bearing cap(s), as required. Make sure locking tangs on bearing inserts are snapped in bearing cap notch.
Clean bearing surface and exposed half of crankshaft journal. Make sure these surfaces are free of oil.

note.para: Do not follow torque to yield procedure until final assembly. Install bearing caps and lower inserts. Torque bolts to 136 N·m (100 lbf·ft) and then 177 N·m (130 lbf·ft).

step1.para: Remove one bearing cap and insert at a time. Leave remaining caps tight while checking bearing clearance fit with cap removed.
Wipe oil from all contact surfaces of exposed journal, bearing insert and cap that is removed.

Place a piece of Plastigage® across full width of bearing surface on crankshaft journal (or bearing insert) approximately 6 mm (1/4 in) off center. Install bearing cap and tighten cap bolt to 136 N·m (100 lbf·ft)and then 177 N·m (130 lbf·ft).

note.para: For in chassis service only - When bearing clearance is checked, crankshaft will have to be supported and held against upper main bearing halves to get a correct Plastigage® reading. Use a jack at counter weight next to each main bearing being checked to support crankshaft. Failure to support crankshaft will result in inaccurate readings.

step1.para: Do not disturb Plastigage®. Use scale on Plastigage® envelope to measure widest point of Plastigage®. This reading indicates bearing clearance in thousandths of an inch or millimeters.
If bearing clearance is not within " Specifications ," crankshaft must be replaced or reground and under size bearings installed (as described earlier in this section).
